description: Named after Irish-born Scottish physicist William Thomson, Lord Kelvin.  For the surname, see Kelvin.

entries.meaning: In the International System of Units, the base unit of thermodynamic temperature; 1‚ÅÑ273.16 of the thermodynamic temperature of the triple point of water. Shown as "K".
A unit interval on the Kelvin scale.
examples: The interval between the freezing and boiling points of water is 100 kelvins.

entries.meaning: (usually as postpositioned adjective) A unit for a specific temperature on the Kelvin scale.
